qas.question: What does being an MSP share with the House of Commons?
When was the British Nationality Act passed?
How old most a person be to apply to be an MSP?
Members of which organizations are disqualified from sitting in the SP as elected MSPs?

answers.text: the police and the armed forces

qas.question: What act sets the term for judging the boundaries of sanity to which individuals wishing to sit on the SP must adhere?
The House of Lords introduced qualifications for which position?
Which job requires that member be under 18?
Which job does not require that the member be a citizen of the UK?

context: As in the House of Commons, <a0_0><a0_1>a number of qualifications<a0_1/><a0_0/> apply to being an <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0>MSP<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/>. Such <a0_2>qualifications<a0_2/> were introduced under the House of Commons Disqualification Act 1975 and the British Nationality Act <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>1981<a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. Specifically, members must be <a2_0><a2_1>over the age of <a2_2>18<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> and must be a citizen of the United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland, one of the countries in the Commonwealth of Nations, a citizen of a British overseas territory, or a European Union citizen resident in the UK. Members of <a3_2>the <a3_0><a3_1>police and the armed forces<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> are disqualified from sitting in the Scottish Parliament as elected MSPs, and similarly, civil servants and members of foreign legislatures are disqualified. An individual may not sit in the Scottish Parliament if he or she is judged to be insane under the terms of the <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>.
